main_definition: Our is a possessive pronoun used to indicate something belongs to or is associated with the speaker and one or more other people included in 'we'. It can also be an adjective to describe things related to us, as well as expressing ownership collectively.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Possessive pronoun indicating something belongs to the speaker and others
Indicating a shared belonging or characteristic among people including the speaker
meanings_and_examples.example: We took our first steps together as a family.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to indicate something that belongs jointly to the group of speakers and others involved
meanings_and_examples.example: Our team won the championship last year.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Expressing a collective ownership or association with an object, place, or concept
meanings_and_examples.example: This is our responsibility as citizens to protect the environment.
